law.catch_line: The Board consists of eight members....

section.section: The Board consists of eight members.

Of the eight members of the Board:
six shall be engineers; and
two shall be consumer members.
The Governor shall appoint the members with the advice of the Secretary and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

The Governor shall appoint each of the engineer members from a single list of at least 3 names of engineers submitted by the local chapters of the applicable professional organization, as set forth in this paragraph and any list of qualified individuals that may have been submitted to the Governor by any person who is a resident of the State.
For the chemical engineer member, the list shall be submitted by the American Institute of Chemical Engineers.
For the civil engineer members, the list shall be submitted by the American Society of Civil Engineers.
For the electrical engineer member, the list shall be submitted by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers.
For the mechanical engineer member, the list shall be submitted by the American Society of Mechanical Engineers.
For the one engineer member identified in paragraph (3)(v) of this subsection, the list shall be submitted by the Maryland Society of Professional Engineers.

text.section:
Each member of the Board shall be:
a citizen of the United States; and
a resident of the State.

section.section:
Each engineer member of the Board shall have:
practiced engineering for at least 12 years; and
been in responsible charge of important engineering work for at least 5 years.
Each engineer member of the Board shall be licensed as a professional engineer in this State at all times during the member's term on the Board.

text.section:
While a member of the Board, a consumer member may not:
have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Board; or
grade any examination given by or for the Board.
Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 5 years and begins on July 1.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 2011.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence, misconduct, neglect of duties, or other sufficient cause.
